string.text: A simple leather jacket and an old shotgun is the bare minimum required to protect oneself from the surrounding reality. By examining the contents in the jacket, one may find a rag mask, a torch, and a pack of cigarettes. Barebones, but better than nothing.
A good old-fashioned AKS-74U with magazines, several grenades, and a high-quality knife; all constituting a versatile set of weaponry against any living, breathing threat.

A small supply of food and medicine, designed for surviving in and adapting to the first few days in a health-threatening environment. Includes several cans of food, a first aid kit, bandages, anti-radiation pills, a pack of activated carbon, and a bottle of home-brewed beverage.

An equipment kit necessary for exploring anomalous areas: a gas mask, a geiger counter, an artefact detector, a lead container, and, of course, a capacious backpack. The rest depends on the skill and ingenuity of the wearer themselves.

A kit for those who regret any time spent without having repaired or dismantled something. A basic set of tools, a tube of quality glue, a little oil, and blue electrical tape; a set for any self-respecting technician.

A strong outfit with excellently balanced properties. The death of the suit’s two previous owners has, fortunately, not affected its appearance or condition, and for your lack of disgust and any prejudice, the local trader has offered a capable flashlight.

A favorable suit of armor with different kinds of pockets and pouches for storing a variety of small objects. Sowing batteries, silenced pistol, radio components, a torn page from a magazine, and an old lighter; it is unclear how keeping all this garbage to yourself would be of any use. On the other hand, something could come in handy for the future.
The arme blanche has always attracted you; its even, metallic gloss has a calming effect. Firearms are a convenient option, of course, but with a knife in your hand, you feel complete.

As a child, you assembled a radio from old parts in your father’s toolbox. In your youth, you repaired your motorcycle with spare parts from a flea market. Now, you feel that you will find some use in the technical debris lying in the Exclusion Zone.

Tasty, high-quality food in the Zone is a rarity, and what stalkers usually eat is hard to consider healthy, but you are able to consume and digest what any other person in their right mind wouldn’t even consider having a bite of.

The gifts of the Zone are alluring but extremely dangerous. Not so long ago, you acquired a special backpack, which should be able to neutralize some of their radiation. The time has come to put it to use.

In whatever condition you find yourself in, whether it be in emotional shock, a wild hangover, or a small earthquake while traveling on public transport, your hand never falters. The grip on your weapon is strong enough to leave dents on the handguard and stock.

Your presence instils fear into the creatures of the Zone; to little surprise, because you are the last thing they see in their life in the vast majority of cases. Having learned how to deal with the carcass of a mutant after an encounter, people begin to fear you.

Whether through charm, a natural ability to socialize, or perhaps a subtle knowledge of human psychology; it does not matter. You easily win the hearts of any person, whether it be a greedy huckster or an outspoken psychopath.

You have learned to notice the most insignificant details not only in the behavior of people, but also in the surrounding environment. During searches, not a single kopeck, bolt, or person manages hides from you…
Humming, hissing, spitting; no types of anomalies are capable of intimidating you any longer, and your urge for exploration encourages you to travel to areas filled with them.
